answers.answer: I forgot to mention:*spinal problems (probably from sitting hunched over with fatigue/head fog)*sugar intolerance*mild hand tremors in the morning

question: Does anyone have a list of suggestions as to what could cause the following* fatigue especially when sitting for too long, feels like a need to lay down and get more blood to the head* head pressure behind the eyes resulting in a feeling of not enough oxygen to the brain, No mucus* brain fog and recalling problems (fixed by caffeine)* lower than average body temperature* low blood pressure* extreme cold intolerance possibly due to lack of circulation* IBS and gluten/dairy intolerance* positive test for Epstein Barr (mono)*worsening of fatigue the week before period (longer than usual time between periods)The following have been ruled out*Lyme*Heart problems*Thyroid (TSH, T4, T3) problems*Diabetes*Sleeping issues (regular sleep cycle), sleep study performed*Depression*Anxiety*ANA normal levelIt feels like something is behind my eyes pushing up against my forehead.Sitting for too long and especially after eating, will feel like my blood pressure has dropped so low that I need to lay down.Its been 10 years like this. Anyone have any suggestions?
title: Head Pressure & Fatigue
